1.3.0-pre.1.name: snowpack
1.3.0-pre.1.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
1.3.0-pre.1.readme:
Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! For other threads, check out our [Package Community](https://www.pika.dev/npm/snowpack/discuss) for general package troubleshooting and discussions. ```bash # Local Setup git clone ${REPO} npm install # Build after every change npm run build # Run the built package directly by path, in some sibling project ../pkg/dist-node/index.bin.js # Or, link the built package to run via CLI in any directory cd pkg && npm link snowpack ```

1.4.1-pre.1.name: snowpack
1.4.1-pre.1.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
1.4.1-pre.1.readme:
Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://termy.netlify.com) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? Create it on [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/), [Glitch](https://glitch.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com/new). Then add it here via PR.

1.6.1-pre.1.name: snowpack
1.6.1-pre.1.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
1.6.1-pre.1.readme:
Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://termy.netlify.com) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? Create it on [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/), [Glitch](https://glitch.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com/new). Then add it here via PR.

2.0.0-alpha.1.name: snowpack
2.0.0-alpha.1.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.0.0-alpha.1.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://termy.netlify.com) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? Create it on [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/), [Glitch](https://glitch.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com/new). Then add it here via PR.

2.0.0-alpha.3.name: snowpack
2.0.0-alpha.3.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.0.0-alpha.3.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://termy.netlify.com) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? 2.0.0-beta.4.name: snowpack
2.0.0-beta.4.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.0.0-beta.4.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://termy.netlify.com) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? Create it on [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/), [Glitch](https://glitch.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com/new). Then add it here via PR.

2.0.0-beta.8.name: snowpack
2.0.0-beta.8.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.0.0-beta.8.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://web-typer-demo.netlify.com/) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? Create it on [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/), [Glitch](https://glitch.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com/new). Then add it here via PR.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://web-typer-demo.netlify.com/) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? Create it on [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/), [Glitch](https://glitch.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com/new). Then add it here via PR.

2.0.0-beta.17.name: snowpack
2.0.0-beta.17.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.0.0-beta.17.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - 2.0.0-beta.21.name: snowpack
2.0.0-beta.21.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.0.0-beta.21.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://web-typer-demo.netlify.com/) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? 2.0.0-beta.25.name: snowpack
2.0.0-beta.25.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.0.0-beta.25.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://web-typer-demo.netlify.com/) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? Create it on [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/), [Glitch](https://glitch.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com/new). Then add it here via PR.

2.0.0-rc.3.name: snowpack
2.0.0-rc.3.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.0.0-rc.3.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

Snowpack
Build web applications with less tooling and 10x faster iteration. No bundler required.

```bash npm install --save-dev snowpack ``` 1. Instead of bundling on every change, just run Snowpack **once** right after `npm install`. 2. Snowpack re-installs your dependencies as single JS files to a new `web_modules/` directory. **↣ Snowpack never touches your source code.** 3. Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://web-typer-demo.netlify.com/) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? Create it on [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/), [Glitch](https://glitch.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com/new). Then add it here via PR.

Build your app, import those dependencies via an ESM `import`, and then run it all in the browser. 4. Skip the bundle step and see your changes reflected in the browser immediately after hitting save. 5. Keep using your favorite web frameworks and build tools! Babel & TypeScript supported. **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)** ## Examples > 🆕 Check out **[`snowpack-init`](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack-init)**! Instantly bootstrap a starter app with Snowpack + Preact, Lit-HTML, TypeScript, and more. - A basic, three-dependency project: [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-example-simple) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-example-simple.glitch.me/) - To-do app with server-side render (Preact + HTM + Express): [[Source]](https://github.com/beejunk/universal-pika-example) [[Live Demo]](https://safe-everglades-56846.herokuapp.com/) - Terminal Homepage (Preact + Typescript + Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/ndom91/terminal-homepage) [[Live Demo]](https://web-typer-demo.netlify.com/) - Electron (using Three.js): [[Source]](https://github.com/br3tt/electron-three) - TypeScript (using Preact): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-ts-preact) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-ts-preact.glitch.me/) - Vue (using httpVueLoader): [[Source]](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pika-web-vue-httpvueloader) [[Live Demo]](https://pika-web-vue-httpvueloader.glitch.me/) [By: [@thiagoabreu](https://github.com/thiagoabreu)] - Vue (using JSX): [[Source]](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin/snowpack-vue) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-vue.netlify.com/) [By: [@unclejustin](https://gitlab.com/unclejustin)] - PWA-Starter-Kit (lit-html + Redux): [[Source]](https://github.com/Polymer/pwa-starter-kit/issues/339) - LitElement + lit-html PWA: [[Source]](https://github.com/thepassle/reddit-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://angry-turing-4769b3.netlify.com/) - [Heresy](https://github.com/WebReflection/heresy) and [LighterHTML](https://github.com/WebReflection/lighterhtml): [[Source]](https://github.com/AhnafCodes/SAltEnv/) - Hyperapp and JSX (using Babel): [[Source]](https://github.com/Monchi/snowpack-hyperapp) [[Live Demo]](https://snowpack-hyperapp.netlify.com/) - React PWA Starter (React + Styled components + Workbox): [[Source]](https://github.com/matthoffner/es-react-pwa) [[Live Demo]](https://es-react-pwa.netlify.com/) - Preact, JSX, Fragment, Router, CSS Grid, Typescript, Babel: [[Source]](https://github.com/crra/snowpack-doodle) - React, JSX, Material-UI and super basic routing: [[Source]](https://github.com/jmetev1/snowpackJSXreact) - A basic svelte setup powered by svelvet: [[Source]](https://github.com/jakedeichert/svelvet) - React Component Library w/Storybook! (React, Typescript, Material-UI): [[Source]](https://github.com/snikas/React-Component-Library) - 🙋‍♀️ Have a great example you'd like to share? Create it on [CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/), [Glitch](https://glitch.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com/new). Then add it here via PR.

2.0.0-rc.8.name: snowpack
2.0.0-rc.8.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.0.0-rc.8.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

**Snowpack is a web app build tool that works without bundling.** Thanks to [ESM imports](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/import) Snowpack is able to remove the expensive (and unnecesary) bundling step from your dev workflow. That means no startup time spent waiting for your application to bundle PLUS no time wasted rebundling on every change. The result is a developer experience that starts up fast, stays fast, and still bundles/optimizes your production builds. ### Key Features - No bundling during development = **<50ms dev server startup** - Instant rebuilds on save (Nothing to rebundle!) - Stays fast as your codebase grows - Built-in [Hot Module Replacement (HMR)](https://snowpack.dev/#hot-module-replacement) - [Custom build scripts](https://snowpack.dev/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins](https://snowpack.dev/#build-plugins) - Bundled production builds **💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

2.7.0-pre.2.name: snowpack
2.7.0-pre.2.description: The faster frontend build tool. Powered by the modern web.
2.7.0-pre.2.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/) 

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler, 

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

2.8.0-pre.1.name: snowpack
2.8.0-pre.1.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.8.0-pre.1.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/) 

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler, 

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

2.8.0-pre.3.name: snowpack
2.8.0-pre.3.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.8.0-pre.3.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/) 

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler, 

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/) 

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler, 

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)

2.12.0-pre.1.name: snowpack
2.12.0-pre.1.description: Run npm packages directly in the browser. No Webpack, Parcel, or bundlers required.
2.12.0-pre.1.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

2.13.4-pre.0.name: snowpack
2.13.4-pre.0.description: The ESM-powered frontend build tool. Fast, lightweight, unbundled.
2.13.4-pre.0.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

2.15.0-pre.4.name: snowpack
2.15.0-pre.4.description: The ESM-powered frontend build tool. Fast, lightweight, unbundled.
2.15.0-pre.4.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/pikapkg/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

3.0.0-rc.1.name: snowpack
3.0.0-rc.1.description: The ESM-powered frontend build tool. Fast, lightweight, unbundled.
3.0.0-rc.1.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)

- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

3.1.0-pre.1.name: snowpack
3.1.0-pre.1.description: The ESM-powered frontend build tool. Fast, lightweight, unbundled.
3.1.0-pre.1.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. 3.1.0-pre.8.name: snowpack
3.1.0-pre.8.description: The ESM-powered frontend build tool. Fast, lightweight, unbundled.
3.1.0-pre.8.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

3.1.0-pre.14.name: snowpack
3.1.0-pre.14.description: The ESM-powered frontend build tool. Fast, lightweight, unbundled.
3.1.0-pre.14.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)

- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

3.3.0-pre.1.name: snowpack
3.3.0-pre.1.description: The ESM-powered frontend build tool. Fast, lightweight, unbundled.
3.3.0-pre.1.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

3.7.0-pre.0.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

3.8.0-pre.2.name: snowpack
3.8.0-pre.2.description: The ESM-powered frontend build tool. Fast, lightweight, unbundled.
3.8.0-pre.2.readme:
[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**

[![CI](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/workflows/CI/badge.svg?event=push)](https://github.com/snowpackjs/snowpack/actions)

### What is Snowpack?

**Snowpack is a modern, lightweight toolchain for web application development.** Traditional dev bundlers like webpack or Parcel need to rebuild & rebundle entire chunks of your application every time you save a single file. This introduces lag between changing a file and seeing those changes reflected in the browser, sometimes as slow as several seconds.

Snowpack solves this problem by serving your application **unbundled in development.** Any time you change a file, Snowpack never rebuilds more than a single file. There's no bundling to speak of, just a few milliseconds of single-file rebuilding and then an instant update in the browser via HMR. We call this new approach **O(1) Build Tooling.** You can read more about it in our [Snowpack 2.0 Release Post.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/)

When you're ready to deploy your web application to users, you can add back a traditional bundler like Webpack or Parcel. With Snowpack you get bundled & optimized production performance without sacrificing dev speed by adding an unnecessary bundler,

### Key Features

- A dev environment that starts up in **50ms or less.**
- Changes are reflected [instantly in the browser.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#hot-module-replacement)
- Integrates your favorite bundler for [production-optimized builds.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#snowpack-build)
- Out-of-the-box support for [TypeScript, JSX, CSS Modules and more.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#features)
- Connect your favorite tools with custom [build scripts](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-scripts) & [third-party plugins.](https://www.snowpack.dev/posts/2020-05-26-snowpack-2-0-release/#build-plugins)

**💁 More info at the official [Snowpack website ➞](https://snowpack.dev)**
